column4: ok im a newbie with ubuntu and i found where im supposed to move the patch  and when i do the " mv ath5k-injection-2.6.27-rc2.patch -T usr/src/linux-header-2.6.35-22/drivers/net/wireless/ath/ath5k" it says " mv: cannot move `ath5k-injection-2.6.27-rc2.patch' to `usr/src/linux-header-2.6.35-22/drivers/net/wireless/ath/ath5k/': No such file or directory"
why is it saying this
you are trying to do something that is beyond you
im trying to patch my wifi card
you said it was above me and ill agree as i am new to ubuntu but have no problems using backtrack and am quick at wep cracking using it but this is on my wifes laptop and she uses ubuntu
have you actually got the linux headers installed?
is it ok to pm you
you missed the slash off the beginning of the destination path
no
also you are using mv -T which makes it treat the destination as a file, not a directory, but you specified a directory. why?
oops didnt notice that 1
what guide are you following? what made you think you should be doing this?
i am following the guide from http://www.aircrack-ng.org/doku.php?id=patching&DokuWiki=f125f415b6f00efac9d6b9e949840b9c  and i have to do it to be able to wep crack with my wifi card
you are going to have to recompile the kernel. are you comfortable doing this?
: no not really
I have also noticed a rather more fundamental problem -- you are trying to patch the headers, when what you need to patch is the source. the headers are just for compiling against
this is too complicated for you
it might be but how am i supposed to learn
try this: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1155599
that looks like it has the solution you need
thank you very much as i understand this post better than any others i have read
you around
